availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Dozier (Knox County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Dozier. Father of Joseph T. Dozier, Sarah Dozier, Mary J. Dozier, Elizabeth Dozier, William O. Dozier, Richard Dozier, and Reason Dozier. Shoemaker in Knox County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Knox County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as captain from September 22, 1861 to March 1, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barboursville, p. 110.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 212.
